lib

Class TextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.TextBox
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OrdersBox

    public class TextBox
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for a visual representation text. It has word wrap enabled and prints out orders character by character in a retro style. It also has support for delays between lines.
    Author:
    Huw Taylor

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(int x,
       int y,
       int width,
       int height,
       int lines)
        Constructor of a TextBox.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate to display the box.
        y - the y coordinate to display the box.
        width - the width the box wrap to.
        height - the height of the box.
        lines - the maximum amount of lines to display at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double delay)
        Changes the speed at which text is 'typed;.
        Parameters:
        delay - the new wait in seconds between each character.

      • addText

        public void addText(java.lang.String order)
        Adds a line of text to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        order - the text to be written

      • delay

        public void delay(double duration)
        Adds a delay, making the textbox wait before continuing.
        Parameters:
        duration - the length of the delay in seconds.

      • newline

        public void newline()
        Adds a newline to the textbox.

        protected int linesBeingUsed()
        Accesses how many lines we are currently using.
        Returns:
        the amount of used lines.

      • isUpToDate

        public boolean isUpToDate()
        Accesses whether we have stopped typing and have no orders queued up.
        Returns:
        whether the TextBox is up to date.

      • update

        public void update(double dt)
        Updates the timer of the TextBox.
        Parameters:
        dt - time since the last update call.
